abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Muyinga Agricultural Development
            project in Burundi. The broad objectives of the project were
            to increase the quantity and improve the quality of food
            crop, coffee and livestock production and to increase farm
            income Up to October 1993, project impact was positive. With
            the revision in the extension methodology in 1992 from a
            top-down to a participative approach, project impact on the
            ground improved remarkably. The project was highly
            successful in introducing improved seeds and agroforestry
            trees to farmers and in enlisting groups of farmers to
            produce these seeds and trees. The overall assessment of the
            project's outcome must be rated as unsatisfactory,
            notwithstanding the important achievements made prior to
            October 1993 and some even afterwards. There are three main
            lessons to be learned from this project: (a) an in-depth
            institutional analysis of participating institutions has to
            be done as part of project preparation and the
            implementation schedule needs to be established on the basis
            of this assessment; (b) the project has clearly underscored
            the importance and positive impact of involving
            beneficiaries in the execution of the project, as was the
            case with the revised approach to extension and the positive
            response to providing support to farmers voluntarily
            organized in groups; (c) the importance of selecting a
            technical assistant that is capable of transferring skill
            and knowledge to local staff.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Muyinga Agricultural Development
            Project, which is to be implemented over a six year period
            in the Muyinga province, seeks to increase the quantity and
            improve the quality of food crop, coffee and livestock
            production and to increase farm income.  More specifically,
            in attempting to achieve this objective, the project seeks
            to address the issues of the agricultural sector as they
            apply to Muyinga province, within the context of the
            Government's broader policies.  To that end, the
            project consists of:  (a) strengthening of research and
            extension services in Muyinga; (b) improvement of marketing
            channels through strengthening of agricultural cooperatives
            in Muyinga; and (c) promotion of agro-forestry and
            environmental protection through reafforestation and erosion
            control.  In addition, the project entails:  (d)
            strengthening animal health services and promotion of the
            integration of agriculture and livestock activities; and (e)
            greater utilization of swamp areas for food production
            through swamp infrastructure improvements.
